story.kicker_image_caption: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav has challanged the forensic reports that concluded that the meat found in the Dadri lynching victim's house was beef.

listicle_content.listicle: The veterinary officer in his report that was cited by the police had earlier said that the sample which was investigated was not beef, but meat of \"goat progeny\". The sample was later sent to the forensic laboratory in Mathura for \'final diagnosis\'.
The report states that the meat found in the Akhlaq\'s house was \"cow or its progeny\".
According to police, the meat was sent for testing only to establish the motive for Akhlaq\'s killing.
Akhlaq\'s family, which has always denied allegations related to beef, has rejected the Mathura lab report.
Mohammad Akhlaq, 52, was beaten to death on September 28 last year in Bisahra village of Dadri district by a mob after the rumours of him and his family consuming beef floated.
BJP MP Adityanath is now demanding release of Hindus arrested in the Dadri lynching case. He has also state government to withdraw all facilities given to Akhlaq\'s family.

story.storykicker: The finding in the recent forensic report is in contrast to the preliminary report of an inquiry by the Uttar Pradesh Veterinary department, which said the meat was mutton of 'goat progeny'.
story.storybody:
Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav today questioned the authenticity of the forensic report which confirmed the presence of beef in Dadri lynching victim Mohammad Akhlaq's house.

"Where was the sample sent, who received it? There was nothing objectionable in his house. Every eye is on this matter. Everyone wants that the victim's family should get justice as murder had taken place," said Akhilesh Yadav.

The finding in the recent forensic report is in contrast to the preliminary report of an inquiry by the Uttar Pradesh Veterinary department, which said the meat was mutton of 'goat progeny'.

Here's all you need to know:

{funfacts}

  1. The veterinary officer in his report that was cited by the police had earlier said that the sample which was investigated was not beef, but meat of "goat progeny". The sample was later sent to the forensic laboratory in Mathura for 'final diagnosis'.
  2. The report states that the meat found in the Akhlaq's house was "cow or its progeny".
  3. According to police, the meat was sent for testing only to establish the motive for Akhlaq's killing.
  4. Akhlaq's family, which has always denied allegations related to beef, has rejected the Mathura lab report.
  5. Mohammad Akhlaq, 52, was beaten to death on September 28 last year in Bisahra village of Dadri district by a mob after the rumours of him and his family consuming beef floated.
  6. BJP MP Adityanath is now demanding release of Hindus arrested in the Dadri lynching case. He has also state government to withdraw all facilities given to Akhlaq's family.
{funfacts}

 

ALSO READ:

Dadri lynching: The meat in victim's house was beef, says forensic report
